Hi all,

I try to keep my partcount to a minimum and my question is this:

When two parts are undocked, and the two parts where reinforced with struts, does the end of the struts that is left after the break count as a part? and if so, does both ends count (as in if the part i started the strut from "keeps" the part or is it the part i connected that get the part)?

Thanks in advance
I don't believe the end-points of a broken strut count as parts for physics calculations, on either end.

Yeah, I once had the ends of struts hanging off my Duna lander, and I didn't detect any loss of performance there. I suppose the bottom end of the strut would count, but not the top; though that is just my reasoning.

If you attack struts to stack seperators then both end pieces get blown into space during separation. So the game must see each strut as 2 objects instead of 1 for physics other wise one end would simply vanish after the strut is broke.
That the object continues to exist visibly doesn't mean it's undergoing physics calculations.
But they are free floating in space
Like radial decoupler scabs, strut scabs disappear the next time the craft is loaded.

Like radial decoupler scabs, strut scabs disappear the next time the craft is loaded.

Really? I didn't know that.
